questions.question: What is heat?
questions.answer: Heat is a form of energy that flows from an object at higher temperature to an object at lower temperature.

questions.question: What is temperature?
questions.answer: Temperature is the measure of how hot or cold an object is.

questions.question: Why can’t we measure temperature accurately by touch?
questions.answer: Because our sense of hot and cold is relative and can be misleading, especially after touching hot or cold objects.

questions.question: Name the device used to measure temperature.
questions.answer: Thermometer is the device used to measure temperature.

questions.question: What is the SI unit of heat?
questions.answer: The SI unit of heat is Joule (J).

questions.question: What is a calorie?
questions.answer: One calorie is the amount of heat required to raise the temperature of 1 gram of water by 1°C.

questions.question: State the relation between calorie and joule.
questions.answer: 1 calorie is equal to 4.18 joules.

questions.question: Name two sources of heat.
questions.answer: Sun and burning of fuels are two sources of heat.

questions.question: What is geothermal energy?
questions.answer: Heat obtained from the interior of the earth is called geothermal energy.

questions.question: How is heat produced in fuels?
questions.answer: Heat is produced when fuels burn and undergo chemical reaction with oxygen.

questions.question: What is atomic energy?
questions.answer: Atomic energy is heat produced during nuclear fission of heavy nuclei like uranium.

questions.question: Why is thermometer necessary?
questions.answer: Because temperature cannot be measured accurately by touch.

questions.question: What is a clinical thermometer used for?
questions.answer: It is used to measure human body temperature.

questions.question: What is the normal body temperature of humans?
questions.answer: The normal body temperature of humans is 37°C.

questions.question: What is the temperature range of clinical thermometer?
questions.answer: It measures temperature from about 35°C to 42°C.

questions.question: Why is mercury not used in thermometers now?
questions.answer: Because mercury is harmful to health and environment.

questions.question: How does a liquid thermometer work?
questions.answer: The liquid expands on heating and its level rises in the tube, indicating temperature.

questions.question: What is a digital thermometer?
questions.answer: It is a thermometer that uses electronic sensors to measure temperature.

questions.question: What is heat content of a body related to?
questions.answer: It is related to total kinetic energy of atoms in the body.

questions.question: What does temperature depend on?
questions.answer: Temperature depends on average kinetic energy of atoms.

questions.question: What are the units of temperature?
questions.answer: Celsius, Fahrenheit and Kelvin are the units of temperature.

questions.question: Which temperature scale is used in scientific work?
questions.answer: Kelvin scale is used in scientific experiments.

questions.question: What is specific heat?
questions.answer: Specific heat is the amount of heat needed to raise temperature of unit mass of a substance by 1°C.

questions.question: Write the formula for heat.
questions.answer: Q = m × c × ΔT

questions.question: Which substance has highest specific heat?
questions.answer: Water has the highest specific heat among common substances.

questions.question: What is a calorimeter?
questions.answer: A calorimeter is an instrument used to measure heat exchanged in reactions or processes.

questions.question: Why is calorimeter thermally insulated?
questions.answer: To prevent heat exchange with surroundings.

questions.question: Why is copper used in calorimeter?
questions.answer: Because copper has low specific heat and absorbs less heat.

questions.question: What happens when hot and cold objects are kept together?
questions.answer: Heat flows from hot to cold until both reach the same temperature.

questions.question: What is thermal equilibrium?
questions.answer: It is the state when two bodies reach the same temperature.

questions.question: What is expansion?
questions.answer: Expansion is increase in size of a substance when heated.

questions.question: Which states of matter expand on heating?
questions.answer: Solids, liquids and gases all expand on heating.

questions.question: What is linear expansion?
questions.answer: Linear expansion is increase in length of a solid on heating.

questions.question: What is coefficient of linear expansion?
questions.answer: It is change in length per unit length per degree rise in temperature.

questions.question: Why do railway tracks have gaps?
questions.answer: To allow expansion during summer and prevent bending.

questions.question: What is volumetric expansion?
questions.answer: It is increase in volume of a substance when heated.

questions.question: Why do bridges have expansion joints?
questions.answer: To accommodate expansion due to temperature change.

questions.question: How do liquids expand?
questions.answer: Liquids expand by increasing their volume when heated.

questions.question: What is anomalous behaviour of water?
questions.answer: Water shows unusual expansion behavior between 0°C and 4°C.

questions.question: What happens when gas is heated in closed container?
questions.answer: Pressure increases because volume cannot increase.

questions.question: What happens when gas is heated in open container?
questions.answer: Volume increases while pressure remains constant.

questions.question: Why does density of gas decrease on heating?
questions.answer: Because volume increases while mass remains constant.

questions.question: What is constant pressure expansion coefficient?
questions.answer: It measures volume expansion of gas at constant pressure per degree rise in temperature.

questions.question: Why do solids expand less than gases?
questions.answer: Because particles in solids are closely packed.

questions.question: What causes expansion at atomic level?
questions.answer: Increase in kinetic energy makes atoms vibrate more and move apart.

questions.question: Why does water have high specific heat?
questions.answer: Because it absorbs more heat with less temperature rise.

questions.question: Why is water used as coolant?
questions.answer: Because it can absorb large amount of heat without much temperature increase.

questions.question: What is meant by heat transfer?
questions.answer: It is movement of heat from one body to another due to temperature difference.

questions.question: What happens to atoms in solid when heated?
questions.answer: They vibrate faster about their fixed positions.

questions.question: Why does hot tea cool down in room?
questions.answer: Because heat flows from hot tea to cooler surroundings.

questions.question: Why do metals expand on heating?
questions.answer: Because atoms gain kinetic energy and vibrate more, increasing the distance between them.

questions.question: What is areal expansion?
questions.answer: Areal expansion is increase in the surface area of a solid when it is heated.

questions.question: Write formula for areal expansion.
questions.answer: A₂ = A₁ (1 + sΔT)

questions.question: What is volumetric expansion coefficient of solid?
questions.answer: It is increase in volume per unit volume per degree rise in temperature.

questions.question: Write formula for volumetric expansion of solids.
questions.answer: V₂ = V₁ (1 + βΔT)

questions.question: Why does hot air balloon rise up?
questions.answer: Because hot air becomes less dense and rises above cooler air.

questions.question: Why do doors get jammed in summer?
questions.answer: Because wood expands due to heat and moisture.

questions.question: What happens to pressure of gas if volume is constant and temperature increases?
questions.answer: Pressure increases when temperature increases at constant volume.

questions.question: What happens to volume of gas if pressure is constant and temperature increases?
questions.answer: Volume increases when temperature increases at constant pressure.

questions.question: Why are bimetallic strips useful?
questions.answer: Because different metals expand differently and can be used to control electric circuits.

questions.question: How does fire alarm work using bimetallic strip?
questions.answer: Heat bends the strip, closing circuit and activating alarm.

questions.question: Why are glass bottles likely to crack when hot water is poured?
questions.answer: Because outer layer expands quickly causing stress and cracking.

questions.question: Why do we leave space in overhead electric wires?
questions.answer: To allow contraction in winter and prevent snapping.

questions.question: Why are cooking utensils made of metal?
questions.answer: Because metals conduct heat well and heat food quickly.

questions.question: Why are wooden handles used in metal utensils?
questions.answer: Because wood is poor conductor of heat and protects hands from burns.

questions.question: What happens to length of rod when cooled?
questions.answer: Its length decreases due to contraction.

questions.question: Why do railway tracks bend in summer if no gaps are kept?
questions.answer: Because expansion creates compressive force causing bending.

questions.question: Why is copper preferred for calorimeter vessels?
questions.answer: Because it has low specific heat and conducts heat quickly.

questions.question: What is meant by thermally isolated system?
questions.answer: A system that does not exchange heat with surroundings.

questions.question: Why is stirring done in calorimeter?
questions.answer: To distribute heat uniformly and get accurate temperature.

questions.question: Why does hot tea cool faster in open cup?
questions.answer: Because heat is lost to air by convection and evaporation.

questions.question: Why is mercury replaced by alcohol in thermometers?
questions.answer: Because alcohol is safer and expands uniformly.

questions.question: What happens to atoms in gas when heated?
questions.answer: They move faster and spread apart.

questions.question: Why do solids have least expansion?
questions.answer: Because particles are tightly packed and strongly bonded.

questions.question: What is latent heat?
questions.answer: It is heat required to change state of substance without changing temperature.

questions.question: Why does ice melt at constant temperature?
questions.answer: Because heat is used to change state, not temperature.

questions.question: What is conduction?
questions.answer: It is transfer of heat through solids without movement of particles.

questions.question: What is convection?
questions.answer: It is transfer of heat by movement of fluids like air or water.

questions.question: What is radiation?
questions.answer: It is transfer of heat through electromagnetic waves without medium.

questions.question: Which mode of heat transfer works in vacuum?
questions.answer: Radiation works in vacuum.

questions.question: Why is black surface good absorber of heat?
questions.answer: Because it absorbs maximum radiation.

questions.question: Why are solar cookers painted black inside?
questions.answer: To absorb more heat from sunlight.

questions.question: Why does spoon in hot tea become hot?
questions.answer: Because heat is transferred from tea to spoon by conduction.

questions.question: Why is air a bad conductor of heat?
questions.answer: Because molecules are far apart and do not transfer heat efficiently.

questions.question: Why do woolen clothes keep us warm?
questions.answer: Because trapped air reduces heat loss from body.

questions.question: Why are double walls used in thermos flask?
questions.answer: To reduce heat transfer by conduction and convection.

questions.question: Why does sweating cool our body?
questions.answer: Because evaporation of sweat takes heat from body.

questions.question: What is evaporation?
questions.answer: It is change of liquid into vapor at any temperature.

questions.question: Why do desert coolers work better in dry weather?
questions.answer: Because evaporation is faster in dry air.

questions.question: Why does water cool earthen pot?
questions.answer: Because water evaporates through pores and takes heat away.

questions.question: Why does hot soup cool faster in a plate than in a bowl?
questions.answer: Because larger surface area increases evaporation.

questions.question: What is insulation?
questions.answer: It is prevention of heat transfer using insulating materials.

questions.question: Why is cork used as insulator?
questions.answer: Because it contains air and reduces heat flow.

questions.question: Why is steam more dangerous than boiling water?
questions.answer: Because steam releases extra latent heat on condensation.

questions.question: What is thermal expansion?
questions.answer: Increase in size of matter due to rise in temperature.

questions.question: Why are chimneys tall?
questions.answer: To allow hot gases to rise and escape easily by convection.

questions.question: Why does balloon shrink in cold?
questions.answer: Because gas contracts on cooling.

questions.question: Why is ice less dense than water?
questions.answer: Because water expands on freezing due to anomalous behavior.

questions.question: Why are expansion joints zig-zag in bridges?
questions.answer: To allow movement due to thermal expansion without damage.

questions.question: Why is study of heat important?
questions.answer: Because it explains weather, cooking, engines and daily life processes.
